newsitem.title: POLAND: AIB to take majority stake in Poland's WBK.
newsitem.headline: AIB to take majority stake in Poland's WBK.

text.p: Allied Irish Banks Plc (AIB) plans to raise to a majority share its 36.3 percent stake of Poland's Wielkopolski Bank Kredytowy SA (WBK) within three years from February 1997, AIB Group's chief executive said.
Tom Mulcahy said on Wednesday AIB would exercise its option to aquire the 23.9 percent stake in WBK currently held by the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD).
"Our intention would be to exercise the option," Mulcahy told a news conference.
He said once AIB became majority owner it would, as required by Polish law, offer to buy all WBK shares held by the remaining shareholders.
WBK, based in Poznan, western Poland, had a net profit of 93.4 million zlotys ($34 million) over the first seven months this year versus 59.5 million zlotys over the same period of 1995.
